content: On June 19, 1991, the Atlanta Braves played a memorable game against the Philadelphia Phillies at Veterans Stadium, where they secured a 7-2 victory. This win marked the beginning of a significant turnaround for the Braves, who would go on to finish the season with a remarkable 94-68 record. The game featured stellar pitching from Tom Glavine, who struck out 10 batters, and was a key moment in the Braves' rise to prominence in the early 1990s, leading to their eventual World Series appearance that year.
